description: The Synology NAS Details dashboard provides detailed information as to the operational status of the system(s).

panels.description: Enter the number of Synology's you are monitoring in the NASDevices variable. A positive Number here means there is a NAS down or not being scraped for data. A negative Number means you are collecting data from more Synology's than the system expects in the NASDevices variable.
panels.title: Synology Systems

panels.description:
The number of
data writes to SSD
for the first time
panels.title: Write Misses: $flashCacheDisk- ($Device)
S.M.A.R.T: $SmartDev (Data is from the last time the Scheduled task was run)

list.description: Total Number of NAS Systems manually entered.
list.name: NASDevices

list.description: This controls whether network interfaces report Megebyte set to 1, Megabits set to 8.
list.name: interfacebits

list.description: Regex controls interfaces to show.  Default: ^eth.*|^bond.*|^docker[0-9]
list.name: Interface

list.description: Regex controls the hrStorageDescr devices  to hide.  Memory is hidden here and used in the "hrMemoryDescr" variable instead.  Default: /^(?!/run|/sys/.*|/dev|.*@docker.*|.*[M|m]emory)/
list.label: File System
list.name: hrStorageDescr

list.description: Regex controls file hrStorageDescr devices to show here.   Default: /.*[M|m]emory.*/
list.label: Memory
list.name: hrMemoryDescr

list.description: Regex controls which services to hide.  Default: /^(?!TELNET|FTP|AFP|OTHER)/
list.name: services

title: Synology NAS Details
